title: Under the Radar Over the Top
text:
Under the Radar Over the Top is the fourteenth <a href="studio%20album">studio album</a> by German <a href="hard%20dance">hard dance</a> group <a href="Scooter%20%28band%29">Scooter</a>. The album was released in Germany on 2 October 2009, preceded by the single "<a href="J%27adore%20Hardcore">J'adore Hardcore</a>" on 14 August. A second single, "<a href="Ti%20Sento">Ti Sento</a>", was released on the same day as the album. The album was released in the UK on 23 November 2009. The third single "<a href="The%20Sound%20Above%20My%20Hair">The Sound Above My Hair</a>" was released on 27 November 2009., and "<a href="Stuck%20on%20Replay">Stuck on Replay</a>", the 4th single from the album is being used as the official theme song of <a href="2010%20IIHF%20World%20Championship">2010 IIHF World Championship</a>.
The album's cover was photographed at the former American <a href="National%20Security%20Agency">NSA</a> <a href="espionage">espionage</a> site <a href="Teufelsberg">Teufelsberg</a> in <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>. The title comes from <a href="Alexis%20Petridis">Alexis Petridis</a>' "<a href="The%20Guardian">Guardian</a>" article about the group's unexpected <a href="United%20Kingdom">UK</a> success in 2008. The album's release was supported by a German <a href="Concert%23Concert%20tour">tour</a> in March 2010.
Under the Radar Over the Top went gold in 2010.
Track listing.
Limited edition.
A <a href="Special%20edition">limited edition</a> version of the album features a second <a href="Compact%20Disc">CD</a> entitled "The Dark Side Edition" and a bonus <a href="DVD">DVD</a>.
"The Dark Side Edition" track listing.
The DVD features a personal Scooter <a href="Travel%20documentary">travelogue</a> from the band’s trip through <a href="Australia">Australia</a>, <a href="Africa">Africa</a> and <a href="Asia">Asia</a> as well as an exclusive interview and selected comments on the album.
20 Years of Hardcore Expanded Edition.
This version, released in 2013, contains the standard album (possibly remastered) and a bonus disc that contains remixes, b-sides, and selected versions of tracks. The bonus disc's track list is as follows:
Deluxe VIP Fan Box.
A second, even more limited edition of the album, entitled the "Under The Radar Over The Top Deluxe VIP Fan Box", includes the same content as the Limited Edition version along with a Scooter <a href="flag">flag</a>, Scooter <a href="Dog%20tag%20%28identifier%29">dog tags</a>, and 5 post cards featuring the band members, and a special box featuring images from the photoshoot of the NSA location on the cover of the album.
UK edition.
The <a href="United%20Kingdom">UK</a> version features a different <a href="https%3A//m.media-amazon.com/images/I/71vmLZxcPEL._SS500_.jpg">cover</a> and includes a <a href="DVD">DVD</a> with all the group's <a href="music%20video">music video</a>s from "<a href="Hyper%20Hyper">Hyper Hyper</a>" to "<a href="Jump%20That%20Rock%20%28Whatever%20You%20Want%29">Jump That Rock (Whatever You Want)</a>", similar to the German re-release of "<a href="Jumping%20All%20Over%20the%20World%23Jumping%20All%20Over%20the%20World%20-%20Whatever%20You%20Want">Jumping All Over the World</a>". The album sold 8,000 copies in the first week after release and entered the official UK album charts at number 62.
Charts.
In 2010. It was awarded a gold certification from the <a href="Independent%20Music%20Companies%20Association">Independent Music Companies Association</a> which indicated sales of at least 100,000 copies throughout Europe.
